Sri Lanka will be up against the West Indies in the 1st match of the West Indies in Sri Lanka, 3 ODI Series, 2024 at the Pallekele International Cricket Stadium, Kandy on 20th October 2024 at 02:30 PM IST.
In their last 5 games, West Indies have won 1 game and lost 4. In their last 5 games, Sri Lanka have won 3 games and lost 1.

Both teams last played against each other in the Super Sixes - Match 9 of the ICC Cricket World Cup Qualifiers, 2023 where Pathum Nissanka scored the highest fantasy points for Sri Lanka with 138 match fantasy points while Keacy Carty topped the fantasy points leaderboard for West Indies with 103 match fantasy points.

The recent run of losses in the ODI World Cup 2023 for Pakistan has coincided with their batters struggling to score runs at a quick rate, with the top order of Abdullah Shafique, Imam-ul-Haq and Babar Azam, finding themselves under more pressure.
In the bowling side of things, the lack of wickets in the early stages from the likes of Shaheen Afridi and Hasan Ali, has led to the oppositions scoring big totals against them.

South Africa batters have managed to score totals in excess of 300 runs in four out of five occasions during the ODI World Cup 2023, with the likes of Quinton de Kock and Heinrich Klaasen notching up multiple hundreds.
The Protea bowlers have shared wickets amongst themselves regularly in the flagship tournament, while being spearheaded by the experienced Kagiso Rabada and Keshav Maharaj.

Shadab Khan went off with a freak concussion after hitting his head on the ground.
South Africa's bowlers and fielders had to front up in the intense, oppressive heat.

Tabraiz Shamsi's one was very marginal and went against Pakistan, but so was Rassie van der Dussen's - which went their way.
After the tensest of tense finishes, here's the moment that Keshav Maharaj sealed the victory.
That defeat does leave Pakistan's hopes of qualifying in tatters. Not completely over, but very unlikely. They are relying on a lot of other results going their way.
South Africa keep their fate in their own hands still, with five wins from six. And they've overcome the big mental hurdle of chasing a target too, which should give them confidence.

It is an absolute choker for Babar Azam, Pakistan knew they had to win this game really. There are all sorts of permutations, but at the moment, it is looking good for India, New Zealand, Australia and South Africa.
A brave, inspiring effort from Pakistan's bowlers. They fought until the very end, three wickets for Shaheen and two apiece for Rauf, Wasim and Mir.

Really good planning from Keshav Maharaj Among all the hype and tension he worked out how to win the game. And that was to see off the Pakistan seam bowlers knowing South Africa would have to bowl three overs of spin, and at least one of the finger spinners who hadn't bowled for 20 odd overs.
It was tense, it was dramatic, it was unbearable at times. But it was a thriller, and that's what we have been crying out for.
Keshav Maharaj was absolutely pumped with those winning runs, bright red in the face and roaring with emotion.
Despite all that, the scenes out there are friendly. All players shake hands and hug, knowing they have all played their part in a cracking encounter.

It's gone for four and South Africa have won this game in thrilling style. Maharaj gets a hug from Shamsi. South Africa have managed to do the one thing they've so far failed at, which is chasing. It looked unlikely at one stage. Pakistan had no ammunition left, no pace bowling left.

We are just a few hours away from the commencement of the much-anticipated West Indies vs England ODI series. This three-match rubber will begin at the Sir Vivian Richards Stadium in Antigua on October 31 (11:30 pm IST).

England will see this series as a much-needed preparation for next year's ICC Champions Trophy in Pakistan. They are currently on a bad streak, having lost a five-match ODI series to arch-rivals Australia followed by a 2-1 Test series loss to Pakistan.
Similarly, the West Indies also had a forgettable white-ball tour to Sri Lanka, where they lost both the T20I and ODI series.
Four debutants for England
Toss: West Indies win and bowl
West Indies skipper Shai Hope praised Evin Lewis, stating, 'He's hungry. I'm glad with the scores he's getting now.'

Liam Livingstone’s reaction: I guess we need to get the rhythm of 50-over cricket as quickly as possible. We know that somebody in the top six has to go on and unfortunately we couldn’t do that today.
I don’t think we adapted that well. West Indies bowled really well and we lost wickets at key stages. Disappointing day but we’ll come back on Sunday, Saturday, whenever it is!

I think everybody saw what JT [John Turner] is about. I thought he bowled really well and was unlucky not to get a wicket which might have changed the game. Hopefully more of the same for the rest of the series.
The match was rain-affected, leading to a revised target via the Duckworth–Lewis–Stern (DLS) method.

The Antigua pitch will have a good pace and bounce initially, which might help the team batting first. As the match progresses, expect the spinners to come into the game more, with the average second-inning score here being less.

England, coincidentally, have a great record at the Sir Vivian Richards Stadium, having won five of the seven games played. They even smashed a whopping 325 runs at the venue in their last ODI bilateral series before the hosts chased it down on the back of Shai Hope's hundred.

The last time ODI cricket was played at this venue was also during a three-match series between the West Indies and England. It was in December last year that England kept the series alive with a win by six wickets.

Sri Lanka will be up against the West Indies in the 2nd match of the West Indies in Sri Lanka, 3 ODI Series, 2024. The match will be played at the Pallekele International Cricket Stadium, Kandy on 23rd October 2024 at 02:30 PM IST.

In the first game of this series, Charith Asalanka was the Man of the Match and scored the highest fantasy points for Sri Lanka with 126 match fantasy points while Gudakesh Motie topped the fantasy points leaderboard for West Indies with 95 match fantasy points.

The pitch at the Pallekele International Cricket Stadium, Kandy will allow for good stroke play and the batters will find it easy to bat on the surface. The surface will not allow a lot of assistance to the bowlers and wicket taking is going to be difficult. The average 1st innings score at this venue in the last 20 matches is 228 runs. The team winning the toss should look to bowl first as the majority of the games played on this ground have been won by the chasing side.

Temperature is expected to be around 25.74 °C with 84% humidity. 1.97 m/s winds are expected. Cloud cover expected, so expect some movement to aid the pace bowlers. There is moderate rain expected which may affect playing conditions.
In the 65 matches played between these 2 teams, batters of both teams have earned the most fantasy points for their respective teams so far.
Sri Lanka and West Indies will lock horns in the 2nd ODI of West Indies tour of Sri Lanka 2024 on Wednesday, 23 October 2024, at Rangiri Dambulla International Stadium, Dambulla.
The weather forecast for the match is overcast with a temperature of 28°C.
The pitch is expected to be batting-friendly with an average first innings score of 270, suitable for both pace and spin.

Predicted playing XI for Sri Lanka includes Nishan Madushka, Avishka Fernando, Kusal Mendis (WK), Kamindu Mendis, Charith Asalanka, Sadeera Samarawickrama, Janith Liyanage, Wanindu Hasaranga, Dunith Wellalage, Jeffrey Vandersay, and Asitha Fernando.

Predicted playing XI for West Indies includes Brandon King, Alick Athanaze, Shai Hope (WK/C), Keacy Carty, Roston Chase, Sherfane Rutherford, Romario Shepherd, Gudakesh Motie, Hayden Walsh, Jayden Seales, and Alzarri Joseph.
Charith Asalanka, the Sri Lankan skipper, expressed that the series win was huge and the team deserved it. He also mentioned the importance of his role batting at number 5.
Shai Hope, the captain of West Indies, reflected on the disappointing performance and emphasized the need to bat better in the Powerplay and play spin better.
Maheesh Theekshana mentioned that he got to play because of the rain and felt lucky. He also discussed the difficulty of playing with the new ball and the ease as the ball gets older.
The match was affected by rain, leading to a delay in the post-match presentation.

The United States of America (USA) and the United Arab Emirates (UAE) will play in the 33rd match of the ICC Cricket World Cup League Two at the United Cricket Club Ground in Windhoek.
The UAE has shown considerable promise in this tournament with a blend of experienced players and young talent.
The USA team has been on a learning curve in this tournament, showing moments of brilliance but struggling with consistency.
The surface at the United Cricket Club Ground in Windhoek is well-known for being balanced, typically providing assistance for both bowlers and batsmen.
Weather in Windhoek is usually pleasant, but teams should monitor forecasts for wind or rain which might affect match conditions.
Key players to watch for UAE include Chirag Suri and Ahmed Raza.
Key players to watch for USA include Monank Patel and Ali Khan.
On paper, the United Arab Emirates appears to be the superior squad due to their current performance, player experience, and head-to-head record.
The United Arab Emirates struggles to gain traction, securing only one victory in five outings, currently ranked last on the points table.
The United States of America has demonstrated impressive form, winning five of seven matches to secure a strong third-place standing.
As the competition intensifies, the United Arab Emirates seeks to revitalize its campaign, while the United States of America aims to maintain momentum and climb the rankings.

The United States of America (USA) and the United Arab Emirates (UAE) are set to clash in the 33rd match of the ICC Cricket World Cup League-II 2023-27 on September 24, 2024, at the United Cricket Club Ground in Windhoek.
The USA team has been in impressive form, winning four of their last five matches, including a convincing 10-wicket victory over the UAE in their previous encounter.
The USA leads the head-to-head contest 6-2 in the last 10 matches, with their most recent win coming in the 27th ODI, where they chased down UAE’s 106 runs in just 15.5 overs.
Key players for the USA include Monank Patel (captain), Aaron Jones (top scorer), and Saurabh Netravalkar (leading wicket-taker).
Key players for the UAE include Muhammad Waseem (top scorer), Ahmed Raza (leading wicket-taker), and Junaid Siddique (key all-rounder).
The United Cricket Club Ground in Windhoek has historically favored teams batting second, with a 53% win rate. The average first innings score is 236, while the average second innings score is 216.

The weather forecast indicates a cloudy day with a temperature of 17.9°C and 60% humidity. The pitch is expected to favor pace bowlers, with 58% of wickets falling to pace bowlers in the last 10 matches.
Given the USA’s recent form and head-to-head advantage, they are likely to emerge victorious.
The match is scheduled to take place at the United Cricket Club Ground, Windhoek, on 24th September, starting at 1:00 PM IST.
The weather forecast for the match day is rainy with a temperature of 24°C.
The pitch behavior is expected to be balanced and best suited to pace bowlers.
The average first innings score at this venue is 224, with a 50% winning percentage for chasing teams.

Head-to-head records in ODIs: Sri Lanka and India have played 168 matches each, with Sri Lanka winning 57 and India winning 99. There has been 1 tie and 11 no results.

Most wickets in ODIs between the teams: Muthiah Muralidaran with 74 wickets for Sri Lanka and Zaheer Khan with 66 wickets for India.
All three One-Days will be played at the R.Premadasa Stadium in Colombo.

The surface at R. Premadasa Stadium is expected to be a well-balanced one. The seamers should get some early assistance from the surface but it will get better as the game progresses. The spinners will come into play in the middle overs as the ball gets old.
There is a 70% chance of rain predicted, with the temperature expected to be in the mid-20s.
This was the first time since 1997 that Sri Lanka have defeated India in a bilateral series.
Sri Lanka on 7 August created history as they defeated India in a bilateral ODI series after a gap of 27 years.
Dunith Wellalage has become the first spinner to take five wickets in an ODI against India on more than one occasion.
Sri Lanka secured their first ODI bilateral series win against India in 27 years.
Avishka Fernando's 96 was the highest individual score in the series.
India lost 27 wickets to spinners over the three-match series, their most in a three-match series.
India and Sri Lanka have faced each other 170 times in Men’s ODIs since their first meeting back in 1979.
India have won 99 and lost 58.
Two ODIs ended in tie while 11 ODIs did not produce a result.
